decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and utilize powerful spells to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding further enhance the deck's synergy, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Scion of Draco provide additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature pressure and burn spells.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The mana ramp provided by Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple allows for quick deployment of high-cost spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return, while cards like Malevolent Rumble and Herigast, Erupting Nullkite help disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Ugin, the Eye of Storms and Writhing Chrysalis to provide additional control and advantage on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on assembling the Heliod, Sun-Crowned combo with Auriok Champion to gain infinite life, and Walking Ballista to deal infinite damage. It also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Ranger-Captain of Eos to tutor for combo pieces and disrupt opponents. The deck aims to control the game with Skyclave Apparition and Conclave Mentor until it can assemble the combo and win the game through either life gain or damage. It also includes additional utility cards like Spike Feeder and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance its strategy.

This UW Control deck focuses on stalling the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through Narset, Parter of Veils and Meticulous Archive. The deck aims to control the game tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Orim's Chant and Teferi, Time Raveler, ultimately leading to a win condition through incremental advantage and powerful finishers like Supreme Verdict and Hall of Storm Giants. The deck also utilizes companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard for additional value and versatility in the late game.

Utilize land ramp and untap abilities to quickly search for and play Primeval Titan, allowing you to tutor for key lands and set up game-winning combos such as Scapeshift. Leverage Amulet of Vigor to gain additional mana advantage and accelerate your game plan. Boseiju, Who Endures and Cavern of Souls provide protection for your key spells, while Urza's Saga can help you fetch utility lands or artifact tutors. Malevolent Rumble and Aftermath Analyst offer disruption and card advantage, ensuring you can stay ahead of your opponent while assembling your combo pieces for victory.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play Death's Shadow as a powerful threat while using cards like Expressive Iteration, Thoughtseize, and Mishra's Bauble to control the board. The deck relies on a low life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and other dangerous creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Nethergoyf. Stubborn Denial and Psychic Frog provide counterspells and disruption to protect your threats. The mana base is optimized for fetching lands with cards like Scalding Tarn and Polluted Delta to ensure consistent gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Goryo's Vengeance to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand from the graveyard. With instant speed reanimation and interaction spells like Force of Negation and Fatal Push, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential. By combining powerful creatures with graveyard recursion, the deck is able to create explosive turns and put pressure on the opponent to keep up with its fast-paced gameplay.

This deck revolves around the combo of cycling cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent to fill the graveyard and then cast Living End to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. By controlling the board with Force of Negation and Subtlety while setting up the combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. The addition of cards like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves help to dig through the deck and find the combo pieces faster. The deck also includes some interaction like Sink into Stupor and Press the Enemy to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to establish board presence early with creatures like Ragavan, and then use burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent quickly. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats, while cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory can help control the board and protect your creatures. This deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly put pressure on the opponent. By playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible. The deck also includes cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to pump up its creatures and ensure they can deal maximum damage. Overall, this deck emphasizes speed and efficiency in its strategy to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some card draw and card selection effects to help find key cards when needed. Additionally, the inclusion of companions adds an extra layer of flexibility and synergy to the deck, allowing for different strategic options depending on the matchup. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently managing resources and answers.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional support and buffs to the creatures. The deck also includes Goblin Bombardment for extra reach and removal, along with various lands and spells to control the board and protect your creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and efficient aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence, dealing direct damage, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It combines aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls with powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to apply pressure and control the battlefield. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides additional value and win conditions. The deck also features elements of token generation and protection with cards like Ocelot Pride and Static Prison. Arena of Glory can give the deck a late-game advantage by boosting all creatures on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with counter spells and removal while generating card advantage through cascade effects and card draw. It aims to control the board early on with disruptive creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Harbinger of the Seas, then overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and spells to finish the game quickly. The deck utilizes a mix of tempo plays and value creatures to create a versatile and aggressive game plan that can adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and graveyard hate while applying pressure with aggressive creatures that have powerful abilities. It aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's development while establishing a strong presence on the battlefield. The deck utilizes cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent, while creatures like Flickerwisp, Solitude, and Witch Enchanter provide a strong offensive and defensive strategy. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disrupt their strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm while utilizing the powerful planeswalkers Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for additional value and pressure. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to apply early pressure and finish the game decisively.
